page.title: 01A GAZETTEER ON BEDWORTH
page.content: {BEDWORTH}is close to the centre of England.It adjoins Coventry,lying North of the city.20 mls East,is Leicester & 22mls West is Birmingham. The M6 & M1,inter-city rail links & proximity to an international airport make every part of the country readily accessible.Recorded in the Domesday Book as having 60 people,it now has a population of 42,500.By 1820 Bedworth was established as a coal mining & ribbon weaving centre,with farming all around.This has resulted in a mixed area;including residential & shopping development,light industry on old mining area & continued agriculture to the West.Bedworth is part of a Labour controlled Borough.Over the years there has been continued movement into & out of the area.It represents a growing &,in parts,multiracial community.
